newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Royale Belge says no decision on AXA-UAP units.
newsitem.headline: Royale Belge says no decision on AXA-UAP units.

text.p: Belgian insurer Royale Belge said on Friday that all options were still open for synergies between units of France's AXA-UAP.

Asked whether the sale of Royale Belge by AXA-UAP was a possibility, Royale Belge secretary general Roland Schockaert said: "The studies that have been conducted do not exclude any scenario. No scenario has been dropped".
Speculation a major shake up in the Belgian insurance sector would be announced next week flared on Friday.
Royale Belge is due to hold its annual shareholders meeting on Wednesday and a decision on the company's future was expected to be announced then.
Schockaert said that studies on the potential of synergies between AXA-UAP units have been conducted since December.
"Some (studies) have been completed, others not and I would not be surprised if there is no indication on which direction synergies would go in different countries of Europe," he said.
Le Monde newspaper earlier said that Royale Belge might be sold to Swiss insurer Winterthur or Dutch financial services group ING.
Winterthur denied the report, ING declined to comment.
